docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile -- The industrial revolution, the latest and most powerful of the five major social and economic upheavals in Latin America this century, took its longest stride across the region in 1967.
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile -- The industrial revolution, the latest and most powerful of the five major social and economic upheavals in Latin America this century, took its longest stride across the region in 1967.
docs.abstract: indus revolution, major '67 upheaval throughout hemisphere, creates new wealth, radically alters traditional power and soc structures; illus; changing RC Ch role, sharp conservative attacks on Alliance for Progress, rise of middle class discussed

headline.main: Latin Industry Speeds Change; Latin Industrial Advances Spur Change

docs.snippet: ASUNCION, Paraguay -- It has long been said here that if the world were flat, Columbus would have found this land at the very edge. But for the last several years Paraguay has been making a strenuous effort to move away from the edge, and with...
docs.lead_paragraph: ASUNCION, Paraguay -- It has long been said here that if the world were flat, Columbus would have found this land at the very edge. But for the last several years Paraguay has been making a strenuous effort to move away from the edge, and with considerable success.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: After three days of recovery, the Canadian dollar came under pressure here again yesterday, closing at 92.15 United States cents against 92.22 on Tuesday. At the day's high it had reached 92.25 cents.
docs.lead_paragraph: After three days of recovery, the Canadian dollar came under pressure here again yesterday, closing at 92.15 United States cents against 92.22 on Tuesday. At the day's high it had reached 92.25 cents.

headline.main: Canada Dollar, Under Pressure, Declines at the Close to 92.15

docs.snippet: Peter Elser, a 47-year-old investment broker, was awarded yesterday the New York franchise in the North American Soccer League. The league was recently formed by the merger of the National Professional Soccer League and the United Soccer Association.
docs.lead_paragraph: Peter Elser, a 47-year-old investment broker, was awarded yesterday the New York franchise in the North American Soccer League. The league was recently formed by the merger of the National Professional Soccer League and the United Soccer Association.

headline.main: NEW YORK ENTERS PRO SOCCER LOOP; Franchise Is Awarded to Elser as 17th Team

docs.snippet: The largest organized program of travel by United States citizens to South American countries will begin next week when the first group of more than 4,000 persons signed up for two-week excursions will take off for visits to Brazil, Uruguay and...
docs.lead_paragraph: The largest organized program of travel by United States citizens to South American countries will begin next week when the first group of more than 4,000 persons signed up for two-week excursions will take off for visits to Brazil, Uruguay and Argentina.

headline.main: NEW LATIN TOURS BEGIN NEXT WEEK; More Than 4,000 Signed for Air-Sea Excursions

docs.snippet: HAVANA, Feb. 6 -- An advance party of British engineers has arrived to begin construction of a $100-million fertilizer plant essential for Cuba's ambitious agricultural plans.
docs.lead_paragraph: HAVANA, Feb. 6 -- An advance party of British engineers has arrived to begin construction of a $100-million fertilizer plant essential for Cuba's ambitious agricultural plans.
docs.abstract: Brit begin construction of $100-million Cuban plant to be completed in '71; plant will double Cuban output of nitrogen fertilizer

headline.main: BRITISH BUILDING BIG PLANT IN CUBA; Fertilizer Facility Illustrates Breach in U.S. Boycott

docs.snippet: GENEVA, Feb. 8 -- The number of unemployed rose last year in every industrialized country but Italy, the International Labor Organization said today.
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Feb. 8 -- The number of unemployed rose last year in every industrialized country but Italy, the International Labor Organization said today.
docs.abstract: ILO repts unemployment more than doubled in '67

headline.main: Industrialized Countries' Jobless Generally Rose in '67, I.L.O. Says

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: ROME, Feb. 9 -- Pope Paul VI today, for the first time, named laymen and women as consultants to a congregation of the Roman Curia, the administrative body of the Roman Catholic Church.
